alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 1:02PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect east central Grafton and central Carroll Counties... At 101 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Conway to 6 miles southeast of Woodstock...and moving southeast AT 20 MPH. Locations impacted include... Conway, Fryeburg, Moultonborough, Ossipee, Tamworth, Sandwich, Woodstock, Bartlett, Madison, Freedom, Albany, Eaton, Chatham, Ellsworth, Thornton, Waterville Valley, and Livermore. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 91 and 96. This also includes... Mount Chocorua, Mount Whiteface, Mount Osceola, Mount Tecumseh, and Welch Mountain. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. * Sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll
